activities.loc: Courtroom D, Fourth Floor - North Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrea Alfonso

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on December 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No violent contact with M.L.A.  Not to consume or possess a controlled substance without a valid prescription and in prescribed amounts only.

10:18 AM Prosecuting attorney Margaret Nan Ginocchio appeared by video supervising intern Verity Altenberger by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Andrea Alfonso appeared by audio.  Attorney Anna Elizabeth Hartz appeared by video for Andrea Alfonso.  Court amends bond to no violent contact with victim.  Defendant to sign amended bond July 13, 2022 between 12 pm and 1 pm.  Attorney Hartz enters not guilty plea on behalf of defendant and jury trial to be set.
Waiver of no contact provision of bond - MA
Adjourned initial appearance on July 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.addlTxt:
Activity: Initial appearance 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

10:10 AM Defendant Andrea Alfonso in court LATE by audio.  Noah M Tylenda appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant address and date of birth verified.  Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived.  Signature bond set of $1000 with conditions. No contact directly or indirectly with victim M.L.A., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere.  Not to consume or possess a controlled substance without a valid prescription and in prescribed amounts only. Defendant must sign bond on June 15, 2022 between 12 PM and 1 PM.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 9, 2022 at 10:00 AM.
